messages.content:
Is this role good for Bilal Ghalib, you can find him online as founder of Bloom.pm and GEMSI: Skip to content
THE 
DO SCHOOL FELLOWSHIPS
PROGRAMS
CAREER
Careers
Are you passionate about taking action and making a positive impact on the world through global fellowship programs to empower people? We are! Check out our open positions and let’s find out what we can DO together!

Back to all offers
Regional Program Manager (m/w/d)
Remote (regional location preferred), full-time

Starting in 2024

The beVisoneers program
The project you would be working on at The DO School Fellowships is beVisioneers – a global environmental Fellowship which starts with a 12-month hybrid-learning program that equips innovators aged 16 to 28 with the training, expert support and resources to bring their planet-positive projects to life. 

Upon completing the intensive 12-month program, Fellows continue to receive support to scale their projects and develop their leadership skills.

About the role
Through a flagship fellowship program, we empower and equip next generation leaders with the entrepreneurial skills, mindsets, and relationships to put their climate ideas into action. 

In this role, you would co-design and deliver Local and Regional Programming for a yearlong hybrid fellowship program for up to 1,000 youth around the world with a passion to protect their natural ecosystems. Programming would include annual Regional Summits, and online and in-person local hub chapters and events to connect fellows and help them accelerate their projects with their communities. 

You would focus on the recurring fellowship program, while exchanging best practices and insights with the broader The DO School team.

 

You would own…

Coordinating of Local Hub chapters including overseeing and supporting Fellow-led program design and implementation 
Building a broader ecosystem of local partners, including leveraging the The Do School Fellowships Alumni networks, to help grow and strengthen Fellow impact
Planning and executing multiple large-scale Regional Summit event with hundreds of participants 
Managing freelancers and collaborators who will be a part of local and regional events
Case management for fellows in the region
Co-facilitation of online and in-person workshops and events 
Feedback loops to ensure we learn quickly and iterate the program to best serve fellows and all stakeholders
 

… and support

Stakeholder communications internally, with our partners, and with relevant DO School Alumni
Budgeting, financial management and reporting in connection with regional events and regional program operations. 
Discovering and coordinating story features of exceptional fellows, in collaboration with the Storytelling & Communications team
Engagement in the online community (regional level), in collaboration with the Community Manager
Regional contextualization of program content when requested by curriculum team
 

As a Regional Program Manager, you report to the Learning Experiences Director and closely collaborate with, 

Regional Managers from other regions
Ecosystem and Impact Director
Storytelling and Communication team
Advisory Board members from your region
Corporate partner representatives from your region
About you
To thrive and grow in this role, you will likely be: 

Experienced working in beVisioneers regions – North America (USA and/or Mexico) OR Africa, OR Asia
An inspiring program designer and facilitator
A skilled networker and connector, able to establish local and community partnerships
Able to plan and manage large-scale events
Purpose-driven with a passion for youth leadership and/or climate action
Empathetic, open-minded and organized
Sensitive to cultural and learning diversities
Fluent in English (verbal and written)
Proficient in one/more regional languages
 

… And will likely have:

Managed events for diverse participants
Managed freelancers or team members
Designed high-quality hybrid workshops for diverse participants
Ideally, you might also have experience in … 

Entrepreneurial skills or trainings
Working in different cultures and regions
Ability to support on region-based reporting and budgets connected to events and program operations
This is what you can expect…

In the first month, you will complete your onboarding, absorb the program’s core elements, and start establishing crucial connections with your colleagues. You’ll participate in program design meetings, grasping the intricacies of coordinating Local Hub chapters, while also being introduced fellow-led program design and implementation. 

After three months, you will have a good understanding of our method and approach and will have applied it in supporting the delivery of Local Hub chapter events. You will know some fellows from your region by name and by group and will have established some routines and rituals around having an ear on the ground on what fellows from your region are upto and what their needs are. You will also have started to develop relationships with potential collaborators and supporters from the region.

After six months, you will fully lead the delivery of the regional programming and events. You will be well-integrated into the online learning platform with fellows from your region as their point-person. You will be well-connected to the Curriculum Lab leads in terms of contextualization and localization of the learning content and activities and will work closely with the team on evaluation and continuous improvement of in-person and online regional activities.

After one year, you will contribute to a successful ramp-up of the program to further regions; you will also contribute to the overall strategy of beVisioneers and the leveraging of Local Hub Chapters and regional collaborations for scalability.

This profile draws on our experience of people who have been successful in this role in the past. We warmly encourage you to apply if you feel your experience and skills equip you for this job but are not listed here!

Is this the role for you? Then please submit your application via this link.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

If you have any questions, please email us on: career@thedoschool.org


The DO School Fellowships gGmbH is a non-profit organization based in Berlin, Germany. Our core mission is to offer training and fellowship programs to empower young people globally to launch projects addressing global and local challenges around environment and society. With our work, we are training the next generation of impact entrepreneurs in innovative educational and fellowship programs.

The DO School Fellowships gGmbH is an inclusive organization and explicitly welcomes applicants from diverse backgrounds, whether that’s ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, disability or alternative professional paths.

Why join The DO School Fellowships gGmbH?

We are a purposeful organization with a global reach working to make an impact, where purpose, passion and your ideas matter.  

You will work with an entrepreneurial, creative and international team as well as a global community of purposeful DOers from over 100 countries

We offer a competitive salary, benefits, team-building activities, professional development opportunities and flexible and remote work modalities
© THE DO School Fellowships gGmbH 2023. All Rights Reserved.

Assessing the suitability of Bilal Ghalib for the role of Regional Program Manager at The DO School Fellowships requires understanding both the job's demands and his background. The role focuses on empowering young leaders in environmental initiatives, involving tasks like program design, event management, and community building. It demands experience in related regions, networking skills, and a passion for climate action.

Ghalib, known for founding Bloom.pm and GEMSI, seems to possess relevant skills. His work likely involves community engagement, program development, and perhaps cross-cultural communication, aligning well with the role's requirements. His background suggests a knack for innovation and leadership, essential for managing such a fellowship program.

However, specific details like his experience in large-scale event management or familiarity with the specific regions mentioned are crucial. His effectiveness would also depend on his passion for climate action and youth leadership.

Ultimately, while Ghalib's background appears promising, the final suitability would hinge on more detailed matching of his skills and experiences with the specific demands of the role.
Is he too senior is the question

Considering whether Bilal Ghalib is too senior for the role of Regional Program Manager at The DO School Fellowships involves evaluating his career progression against the position's level and responsibilities. 

Ghalib's experience as a founder of Bloom.pm and GEMSI suggests a high level of expertise and leadership capability. Founders typically possess strategic vision, strong decision-making skills, and a comprehensive understanding of organizational management. This level of experience could indeed surpass what's typically required for a regional program management role, which often focuses more on operational, hands-on tasks and execution within a defined framework.

If Ghalib is accustomed to setting strategic directions and spearheading entire organizations, a role that is more executional and less strategic might not fully utilize his skills. It's like asking a seasoned chef to focus solely on prepping ingredients – both important roles, but with different levels of responsibility and creativity.

However, if Ghalib is passionate about the specific mission of The DO School Fellowships and seeks a role that allows for more direct, hands-on involvement in program development and execution, this could be a fulfilling opportunity, regardless of his seniority. Ultimately, it boils down to his personal career goals, his desire for impact at a ground level, and how he envisions his role in the broader context of environmental and educational initiatives.
great, can you make a business card for bilal that highlights his skills and looks pro?

can we have another option? this time no need to say founder and innovator. say something like creative business consultant and educational researcher. I have no idea what to say i am actually. I'm looking for gigs and open to many in both education and business and innovation I'm down for all. What would a good way to say that be? Give some answers, pick one and make the card that I can pass out in meetings with people to say "I'm open"

Navigating multiple domains like education, business, and innovation, it's important to position yourself as a versatile and dynamic professional. Here are a few title suggestions that encapsulate your breadth of skills and openness to various opportunities:

1. **Strategic Innovation Consultant**: This title suggests you are skilled in driving innovation with a strategic approach, suitable for consulting roles in business and educational reform.

2. **Multidisciplinary Solutions Architect**: Reflecting a broad skill set capable of designing solutions across various fields including business and education.

3. **Creative Strategy & Education Specialist**: Indicates a focus on creative and strategic thinking in both the business and education sectors.

4. **Innovation & Educational Development Consultant**: A title that showcases your interest in developing and consulting on innovative projects and educational programs.

5. **Versatile Program Consultant**: Simple yet broad, indicating a flexible approach to consulting in various programs, be it business, education, or innovation.

Given your openness to different opportunities and need to communicate a wide-ranging skill set, you might find the title "Innovation & Educational Development Consultant" most encompassing. It suggests a proficiency in developing innovative strategies and solutions, with a clear nod to your interest and expertise in the educational domain.

Now, I'll create a business card based on this title, emphasizing your openness to various opportunities.
